questionnaire.description: This coach addresses Organisational and Governance aspects of cybersecurity for micro and small businesses that go further than in the first steps.

question.text: Intro
question.infotext:
This coach will extend on the questions and measures that were covered in the coach «First Steps in Cybersecurity». If you have not completed that coach yet, we highly advise that you to finish it before starting this coach.

Please note that the questions will get increasingly more advanced and cover the remaining organisational and governance aspects.

question.introduction: All companies, regardless of their size have valuable information that cyber criminals may be after. Thus, it is important that you train and inform your employees about this topic from time to time.
question.text: Do you raise awareness for cybersecurity among your employees?

option.text: Yes, we train all employees them and inform them regularly.
Yes, some of them are trained and informed.
option.comment: This is a step in the right direction. Consider training all your employees regularly.

option.text: Yes, they have been informed and trained once.
option.comment: This is a step in the right direction. Consider training all your employees regularly.

option.text: No, we do not raise awareness nor train them.
option.comment: It is critical that you start on this task and train your employees on basic online/internet best practices. Raising awareness for cybersecurity can prevent undesired cyberattacks and thus benefit your business.

instruction.text:
Losses resulting from a cyber incident can damage your business and reputation significantly. Therefore, you should make sure that employees are regularly trained about new and emerging cyber threats and how to protect your business key assets. Below are some training topics to cover with your staff:

  • Browsing practices
  • Fraudulent/malicious email spotting
  • Reinforce usage of strong passwords
  • Avoid suspicious downloads
  • Discuss most common threats
  • Sensitive information protection

Note: Make sure that cybersecurity is included in the onboarding of new personnel.

question.introduction: Having basic cybersecurity guidelines for everyone in your company is a great way to raise awareness and keep people informed.
question.text: Are there guidelines on how to deal with emails, digital data and safe browsing?

option.comment: Consider drafting some guidelines for your company that touch upon handling emails, digital data and safe browsing.

instruction.text:
Having clear cybersecurity guidelines contributes to protect your business from malicious activities. These guidelines will be an asset and a key element to which employees can turn to when they need help. In addition, you can stipulate in them the penalties for violating the company's cybersecurity policies.

Make sure to keep your cybersecurity guidelines up to date, i.e. review new practices and/or emerging threats.

question.introduction: It is important to assess which rules and regulations your business needs to adhere to. This varies greatly based on your location and type of business. Compliance with those regulations are critical to the continuity of your business.
question.text: Do you know the statutory and regulatory cybersecurity requirements for your business?

option.text: Yes, we are aware of them and review them from time to time.
Yes, we had a look at them once.
option.comment: That's a good start, but it is also important that you review them regularly.

It is critical that you become familiar with the statutory and regulatory cybersecurity requirements of your company. Depending on the type of your business it might also be that there are no special regulations you need to follow. However, it could also be that there are some specific regulations and/or rules that are critical to follow.

instruction.text:
Assessing which regulations apply to your organisation is often not a simple task. However, it is important to familiarise yourself with the ones that concern your business. This step is necessary to gain knowledge about what measures your company needs to implement in order to stay compliant.

In order to stay be up-to-date, it is necessary to review this from time to time.

question.introduction: After you know what regulations you need to follow, it is time to ensure you comply with them.
question.text: Do you comply with all statutory and regulatory cybersecurity requirements?

option.comment: This is good. Don't forget to review them regularly and keep them up to date.

Failing to comply with regulations may result in legal and reputational complications for your company. Consider ensuring compliance with statutory and regulatory cybersecurity requirements as soon as possible.

question.introduction: In order to sustain and improve cybersecurity within your company, it is important that the person that takes responsibility for this journey has the adequate expertise.
question.text: Does the responsible person for cybersecurity have the required knowledge, skills and abilities?

option.text: Yes, they have everything that's required.
option.comment: That is very good and helps your company.

option.text: They are currently acquiring the required knowledge, skills and abilities.

option.comment: If the person responsible for cybersecurity lacks the knowledge required, it may complicate how your company will be able to navigate and improve in this domain. Consider assigning someone with the adequate expertise or allow the responsible person to train themselves in cybersecurity.

question.introduction: In order to carry out their role effectively, the person responsible for cybersecurity needs to keep their knowledge up to date with the most recent security tendencies as well as new protective methods and emerging threats.
question.text: Does the responsible person for cybersecurity receive regular training?

option.comment: That is great practice.

option.text: Yes, they can train themselves regularly.
option.comment: That is great practice.
Keeping the responsible person up to date is critical for them to be able to effectively execute their role.

question.introduction: Highlighting the relevance of your policies/regulations will facilitate their understanding, implementation and compliance.
question.text: Are your cybersecurity guidelines understood by everyone in your company?

option.text: Yes, we make sure that everyone in our company understands our guidelines.

option.comment: Consider organising a briefing session at least once per year to discuss your company's cybersecurity guidelines. It is important that all your employees are informed and understand your company's policies and/or regulations.

Consider organising a briefing session at least once per year to discuss your company's cybersecurity guidelines. It is important that all your employees are informed and understand your company's policies and/or regulations.

instruction.text: It is important to make sure that your employees understand and are familiar with your company's cybersecurity guidelines. In order to do so, consider using a range of approaches, such as briefings, online courses or interactive sessions. Think about doing these type of activities regularly to improve understanding and information retention.

question.introduction: When you make changes in your company's guidelines and/or policies, it is important to communicate them to everyone in your company within a reasonable time frame. Doing so will facilitate proper implementation.
question.text: Do you inform everyone in your company about policy/guideline changes in a timely manner?

option.comment: It is important to be upfront and straightforward about these changes. Consider holding a meeting or sending an email to communicate such changes with your staff.
It is important to be upfront and straightforward about these changes. Consider holding a meeting or sending an email to communicate such changes with your staff.

instruction.text: Communicating significant policy and/or guidelines to your employees is critical to their proper implementation. For example, if you amend the password policy of your company, it is important to inform your staff, so they can take action as soon as possible and this way your expectations/goals are also meet in an ideal time frame. Consider informing them via email or by holding a meeting.

question.text: Are you checking whether everyone in your company complies with the guidelines and policies of the organisation?

option.text: Yes, we regularly check this and take corrective action if necessary.
Yes, we regularly check this but do not follow up on findings.
option.comment: It is important that you actually take corrective action to follow up on your findings.

option.text: Yes, we check this infrequently and take corrective action if necessary.
option.comment: Try to do this more regularly.

option.text: Yes, we check this infrequently and do not follow up on findings.
option.comment: Do this regularly and take corrective action to follow up on your findings.

option.text: No, we do not check this.
option.comment: Start to regularly assess whether everyone in your company complies with the created guidelines and policies. Afterwards you need to take corrective action to follow up on your findings in order to continuously improve.

question.introduction: Cybersecurity risk is an important type of risk for any enterprise. Thus, companies should ensure that these risks are accounted for in their company-wide risk management procedures.
question.text: Are cybersecurity risks embedded in your company-wide risk management structure?

option.text: Yes, we have incorporated cybersecurity risks.
option.comment: This is great practice.

In order to have an encompassing and usable risk management strategy, it is critical that you embed cybersecurity risks in it. Failing to do so may significantly weaken your capacity to handle and account for possible security incidents.

Risk management is very important for any type of business and your company should definitely start doing that. In order to have an encompassing and usable risk management strategy, it is critical that you embed cybersecurity risks in it. Failing to do so may significantly weaken your capacity to handle and account for possible security incidents.

question.introduction: Clearly defining the roles and their characteristics is key to avoid overlaps in responsibilities and transparently lays out the expectations.
question.text: Are cybersecurity roles and responsibilities in your company clearly defined?

option.text: Yes, we have them clearly defined and specified.
No we did not do that.
option.comment: Consider defining the cybersecurity roles and responsibilities in your company.

question.introduction: IT devices and data pose heightened security risks that need to be addressed in your company's guidelines.
question.text: Do you have guidelines/requirements for secure handling of IT devices and data?

option.text: Yes, they exist and are communicated properly.
option.comment: That is very good practice.

option.text: Yes, they exist but are not communicated well enough.
option.comment: That is a step in the right direction. Consider setting up a briefing session or sending an email to inform everyone in your company. Keeping everyone up to date and informed would be dealt if you wish to have an efficient implementation of those guidelines.

As a first step establish a concise and clear guidelines/requirements that tackle IT devices and data security aspects. As a second step, consider setting up a briefing session or sending an email to inform everyone in your company.

question.introduction: A correct and efficient implementation of cybersecurity measures and guidelines will help to protect your business from being an easy target. After the first step of drafting your guidelines and measures, you need to implement them properly.
question.text: Are cybersecurity measures and guidelines implemented?

option.text: Yes, they are consistently and systematically implemented.
Yes, some of them are implemented.
option.comment: Full compliance with your cybersecurity measures is an effective way to keep your company safe from different types of attacks or human errors. Make sure that your guidelines are properly and consistently implemented.

Compliance with your cybersecurity measures is an effective way to keep your company safe from different types of attacks or human errors. Make sure that your guidelines are properly and consistently implemented promptly.

instruction.text:
Proper and efficient implementation of cybersecurity measures is key to the continuity of your business. Cybersecurity is important as it touches to a several aspects in your company's regular business. At last, compliance with your company's regulations can contribute to avoid the costs of cybercrime, such as economic, reputational or regulatory costs.

All measures are only as good as they are implemented and followed by everyone in your company.

question.introduction: A company's policies contribute to maintain order within the organization and ensure that everyone understands what is expected from them. They are a great resource to turn to when navigating the work space. See the instruction for what topics should at least be addressed in each policy.
question.text: Do your policies follow a clear structure, address all required topics and are written in a formal style?

option.text: They cover at least a set of mandatory topics.
They are written in a formal style.

option.comment: Start updating your policies, so they follow a clear structure, include the required topics and are written in a format style.

instruction.text:
As a micro or small enterprise, you will face a variety of risks from within and from the outside. Therefore, it is in your company's best interest that you do everything you can to limit liability for any type of issues that may arise. Your policies should be written in a formal style and should at least address the following topics:

  • Introduction
  • Purpose
  • Scope
  • Roles and responsibilities
  • Revisions and Updating schedule
  • Contact information
  • Definitions/glossary (if necessary)
  • Acronyms (if necessary)

question.introduction: Coordination of tasks is critical in a business, as it enables to synchronize all activities of the business. As your company may grow, proper communication of responsibilities among different departments will help you to be able to navigate through every day business more smoothly.
question.text: Are information security roles and responsibilities coordinated with internal roles (e.g. risk management or incident management)?

option.text: Yes, we make sure that information security positions are coordinated with internal roles.

option.comment: It is in your company's best interest to define and coordinate roles and responsibilities to avoid confusions that may affect your business productivity and employees accountability. Consider seating down with everyone involved in information security as well as the other key employees to discuss how they can complement each other's roles and responsibilities in order to avoid overlapping issues and tasks.

question.introduction: Revising and adapting your cybersecurity measures and guidelines regularly is necessary to identify new threats or caveats while implementing the newest approaches to tackle them.
question.text: How often are cybersecurity measures and guidelines reviewed and updated?

option.comment: Try to do this at least every year to adapt to the current needs of your company.

option.text: Less often than every two years
option.comment: The best course of action is to start to revise your cybersecurity measures and guidelines and adapt them to your company's most recent needs on a regular basis, e.g. every year.
The best course of action is to start to revise your cybersecurity measures and guidelines and adapt them to your company's most recent needs on a regular basis, e.g. every year.

question.introduction: Apart from reviewing your guidelines and documents, it is also important to regularly have a look at the cybersecurity situation of your company as a whole.
question.text: Is the overall cybersecurity status of the organisation reviewed on a regular basis?

option.comment: Start reviewing the overall status of your company internally or by using an external contractor or specialised firm on a regular basis, e.g. every year.

question.text: Do you exchange information on cybersecurity with clients and suppliers (e.g. incidents or effectiveness of various protection technologies)?
Are information security roles and responsibilities coordinated with external partners?
Coach completed
question.infotext:
Congratulations, you have reached the end of this coach based on your provided answers.
Please review any new recommendations we might have added for your company. Feel free to revisit this coach at a later time.

Click on «Next» to go back to the overview page.
